titles.title: Comprehensive Survey of Young Offenders Act
To evaluate the effectiveness of the juvenile justice system and report on certain information.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 6/13/1995--Introduced. Comprehensive Survey of Young Offenders Act - Directs the Bureau of Justice Statistics to submit to the Congress a report on juvenile justice systems across the country, which shall: (1) include a survey of data currently available in representative States and localities regarding juvenile offenders arrested for an offense; and (2) design and estimate costs for a program to improve data collection by identifying young offenders by name as they flow through the system, compiling records for penalty analysis, and encouraging States to cooperate in a pilot program to test the feasibility and value of a new reporting system.
